title: Please riot don't ruin IE for all none ADCs
body:
IE is most commonly built on adcs

I understand that riot wants to make PD more powerful and increase the decision making between it and shiv,  but this powerswapp is not the way to go about that.

ADCs are the only real class that can buy both IE+PD there are very few exceptions to this. End of the day this is same end result for adc but a nerf to anyone who would buy just an IE (some bruisers assassins) 
or those that would want IE and specifically NOT a PD

Some examples would be 

Talon - this guy got hurt with the silence nerf,  but when playing him a combination of Youmou + IE is solid the active for closing in on people, the combined crit chance and damage for taking out targets, the crit damage and the armor pen make a nice little combo for him. New PD does nto fit in there nicely so just a damage nerf there.

Gangplank - the good ol tri+ie+shiv core is great on him  the guy can be scary to squshies but isn't in the best place right now overall, for the one who is probably most reliant on crit the nerf hurts.  PD just doesn't work as  well on him. GP loves the on hit proc from shiv and the gold building in avarice for a bit of a bank route is great.  

other effected champs include, trynd, yi, etc... melee champs who favor damage



EDIT
5% crit chance is being moved from IE to PD

replies.body: They should just change how crit works.  It is downright ridiculous that they refuse to do so, when math proves that in the end it will be the same, and because the end result shall be the same, we can FINALLY balance it properly.

Well, they already ninja patched it by introducing the pseudo RNG distribution to decrease the probability of two crits in a row or long periods without critting. What it led to, though, was abusing the system by putting 1% crit chance in runes, which the PRNG makes into more than 1%.

The easy way would be replacing crit with "+X% autoattack damage", but one argument against it is that it would make ADC's damage a little bit too stable and reliable. Crits aren't a problem in teamfights at all. All we need is to remove them from lane, and IE nerf is doing only half of the job (nerfing the IE rush).

What should happen (IF we're not removing crit altogether):

* **remove crit from lane**
 * no crit runes
 * no Brawler's Gloves (Zeal is dagger+dagger)
 * no Avarice Blade
* **critical strikes should deal less damage**, and be a tiny bit more frequent - so it's not "huge spike out of nowhere", but standard AA variance
 * +50%-75% total AD on crit?
 * OR +100% base AD (just like Spellblade. Sheen effect could be as well changed to "Your next basic attack crits") - that one would differentiate between AD builds and AS-crit builds
 * IE would bring crit back to +100% total AD, and not +150%
 * Alternatives to IE: Triforce (+200% base AD), Lichbane (+50% AP) et caetera
* tweak all ADC items around on-crit effects (like Statikk Shiv) with higher chance of crit, but less damage
 * "carry item" would be more or less synonymous with "scales with crit"
 * items wouldn't need to provide crit to scale with it - you'd rush a crit-scaling item, and then get stronger with 2nd item that has crit
* Crit effects don't have to be 200% damage, example effects:
 * 4 bolts from Hurricane
 * Statikk Shiv procs on crits for less damage, fully charged passive guarantees you a crit on your next attack
 * BotRK (without the damned active, by the way): on-hit 6% hp, crit 10% hp (currently: 8% hp on hit)
 * Phantom Dancer granting extra MS or AS on crit (much like the Frenzy mastery)
 * some new items for the fun of it

And so on. That could make crit a more fun and less obnoxious build. And please don't tell me that ADC damage output has to be 100% stable. I won't believe that you keep track of Statikk Shiv charges or Caitlyn's (or Yi's) passive on your enemy.

[Full post with all the items and stuff](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/IYxQE13A-pyros-item-overhaul-the-carryfighter-project-critical-strike-rework-fighter-items-rework)

But yeah, the easy way out would be replacing crit chance with +% base AA damage.

there really isn't a problem with it in lane. Most adc's even in challenger don't take 1% crit runes and haven't since s3 and things like avarice blade though it's nice to get a crit from it the fact is that it's such a shitty item that even if you get a few lucky crits you should still lose with it so you can only really get it when ahead or when you can't be punished and then the point of the item is for the gold generation.

Also no matter what you say most crit isn't bought first in lane. For instance the crit from the IE components is bought last and it's horrible to buy it first or second because it's underwhelming and unless your really really lucky it won't do anything for you. So really unless you went a greedy build path you won't get crit until about the end of the laning phase in which your lane in already decided.

I think a powerswap between IE and PD is a lot better than leaving IE in its current place. IE is currently rushed on just about every traditional marksman, making bot lane focus less on skill and more on the RNG that comes out of critical strikes, while PD currently currently isn't bought because its stats and passive do not make it worth picking up over the better alternative, Shiv.

IE + PD will provide more damage, while IE + Shiv will have a little bit more waveclear but less actual damage. But most importantly, hopefully ADC's will stop rushing IE in the bot lane.

I'm all for increasing the decision making between Shiv and PD for the botlane
I'm also down for changing up the rush IE meta

but this specific change hurts several other champions, some of which are in a good place and shouldn't be hurt, or are in a less the favourable position and really don't need to be hit again.

Yes a change should be done but not this.

Because full build adcs are the same (they either chose damage or even more damage)

Yes pls.

Something else I didn't touch: a lot of melees that buy Infinity Edge either have other options for builds (ie. Talon could go for a more AD/armor pen build instead of the crit build) or buy enough crit for IE to still have use (Yasuo, Tryndamere, and Master Yi all fall in this category), so this isn't too big of a nerf on most melee champs. The only exception to this would be Crit Gangplank, but even he could modify his build to focus more on either on-hit effects from TF/IBG and Shiv or to have a little bit more crit chance, and even then 5% probably isn't the end of the world.

It's the smart and logical thing to do.

It will cut down a bit on his wave clear but if you are complaining about having to buy TF+Shiv+IE then i think this is a better option.

With a side of get rid of crits all together.

With the mobility on some melee characters, plus the inherent AD advantage most have, melee doesn't really need to be higher. IE is still a great item on champions like Rengar, Shaco, and Gangplank, but the rest often expend their mobility to get into range, and then can't seal the deal like the others (or be ranged like GP). And as far as Shiv goes, the whole idea is to make the Shiv actually get passed over for PD occasionally anyway... Right now, the item is just not worth its cost.

I'm all for the swap, for the most part. IE should be *THE* crit item, which it is, but it also happens to have the highest AD an item can get aside from Maw of Malmortius at low HPs and a highly stacked Sword of the Occult. It's super overpowered, and it's been obvious for a long while. The only question I have is: Why cut crit from the item instead of AD? Make the ADC champs pack on that AD separately, don't make them a jack-of-all-trades on one item...

If they nerf the ad damage to much it won't be built because there's plenty of items that give adc crit so that if IE doesn't have AD it becomes useless and just giving it more crit to compensate might buff adc early game and make them weaker later which I don't know how that would work. and if it didn't buff them early they would still be weaker later which would make it the most boring meta ever which is the tank meta.

Tanks are seriously op and unfun. They have a boring laning phase. (remember renekton and shyvana in the LCS?) 
Tanks even though they only build defence do a shit ton of damage. I mean seriously pick mundo build him full tank and put you W on and through some cleavers and you'll be suprised that while being the tankiest guy in the game you do a shitton of damage. and the only reason these tanks aren't played a lot is because that before you completely ramp up there opponents can impact the map elsewhere and adc's can still do damage to them. People say LW is op and I say it is only because of how op armor is. I mean go play an adc and play a few games and when you get 11 kills and still can't do shit until you get a LW because 2 enemies bought a tanky armor item is a bit absurd. I mean really you have the highest dps in the game and your fed and still can't do anything because against one tank item until you get a LW. People always go on about how tanks where nerfed and all that and it's true buy adc's where also nerfed. I mean people thought adc's would become completly worthless from s2 to s3. I mean have you seen the PD changes from that time they took of like 10% attack speed I believe some crit and about 7% movement speed on it and this was when BT was the first build item. If you think adc's are attack damage carries then you should have played back then when they weren't marksmen but real carries needed in the game to kill the stupidly tanky bruisers who don't build a single damage item but still deal a fuckton of damage.

Now Riot seems to be trying to do the opposite instead of having tanks build tanky and deal a ton of damage they seem to be trying to have them build more damage and still be tanky. So like Rek'sai and Gnar are examples where they can build a lot of damage and there kits still make them pretty tanky.

Tanks are a problem because carries are a 1-stop-shop. If they were actually difficult to build for and make prosper endgame, sure, tanks could be more laxed. However, they're often ready to dish damage immediately after the laning phase, forget farming up from there.

I didn't say IE should lose all its AD, but honestly, it really should. PD and Shiv fit basically the exact same roles, but until this next patch, Shiv was simply better with a real passive. One of them needs to be shifted into an AD/Crit item, and IE should be the Crit/Crit Dmg item, with maybe bits of flair in other areas. Many characters can't even use the Attack speed the other two use (Gangplank mostly, Fiora/Yi are up there since they are melee and therefore it's hard to hit enemies unless they stand still, plus already have AS buffs). Those characters are getting EVERYTHING they need on one item, and nobody should be built so easily. Highest natural AD item in the game, not far off on Crit Chance, and only Crit Damage item... It should not be that good.

Ranged Carries are supposed to work for the damage lategame. At the moment, only non-crit ones have to do that since crit ones are ready so early. It's probably an effect from the LCS, actually, since their games are typically much shorter and efficient than traditional games. They want the carries ready early on, and IE helps make that happen.

IE should just be removed outright, like how {{item:3128}} is getting the axe.

Games shouldn't be decided by who gets the first IE crit.

BT+PD+LW,Brok or  another PD is the next item.

Maybe if Riot actually focused on nerfing ADC instead they would make this game balanced, but all they do is nerf everything else.
